section.docs:
Users can follow different resources in the system. This will give them read access. It will also add related activities to their feed. Followable resources inhert their `public` setting from the `account`. If someone is public, following requests will automatically be approved. If something is private, the person in charge of it will have to approve it. A person can choose to no longer follow something at their will.
These resources can be followed:
1. Users 2. Contacts 3. Teams 4. Campaigns 5. Deals 6. Groups

section.title: Routes & Permissions
section.docs:
* `POST /users/:id/follow`: Anyone * `POST /contacts/:id/follow`: Anyone * `POST /teams/:id/follow`: Anyone * `POST /campaigns/:id/follow`: Anyone * `POST /deals/:id/follow`: Anyone * `POST /groups/:id/follow`: Anyone * `GET /followings`: Anyone according to scoping * `GET /followings/:id`: Any according to scoping * `DELETE /followings/:id`: The follower or god * `PUT /followings/:id/approve`: The resource manager or a god
### Scoping
You are only allowed to access your own following requests.
